channel.title: sillygwailo tweets

item.description: What if we stopped commemorating traumatic events on a yearly basis?

item.description: @heyrickie Would you like to write the entry on petrichor for my forthcoming book, Vancouver: The Good Parts?

item.description:
My agent didn‚Äôt tell me this was happening today. I‚Äôve got to fire that agent. https://t.co/IzfCDRMkdT

item.description: This tweet, now deleted, was about how, when guys talk to each other, it‚Äôs only ever one guy talking about himself and then the other guy talking about himself, as if they were comparing their resumes.

item.description: @joshtpm Just wait until you hear what other countries he‚Äôs also king of.

item.description: @Planta It was still a bit Shakespearean, and the plot was almost exactly the same as House of Cards: To Play the King (except in this case, Diana is a ghost and not still alive). Which is to say, I liked it.
item.source:markdown: @Planta It was still a bit Shakespearean, and the plot was almost exactly the same as House of Cards: To Play the King (except in this case, Diana is a ghost and not still alive). Which is to say, I liked it.

item.description: I‚Äôm also purposely staring at people who are taking selfies in public, though the funny looks I get when they notice mean they don‚Äôt expect to be stared at.

item.description:
TIL that the Toronto Star‚Äôs style guide prefers ‚Äúshirzee‚Äù over ‚Äúshirsey‚Äù (my preferred spelling) for a sports team t-shirt with a player‚Äôs name and number on the back. https://t.co/LuFqPmOUKJ

(He says, wearing his beloved Seattle Mariners Ichiro #51 shirsey he bought on sale after he was traded to the Yankees.)

item.description:
TIFF, especially when King St. W. is closed to vehicle traffic, is a people-watcher‚Äôs dream scenario.

item.description:
The first Friday after Labour Day is the best Friday.

The back-to-school period can be a little overwhelming for people who wanted to be parents, though.
